channel.title: Comments on: SQL Advent 2012 Day 18: Stay relevant and marketable
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.content:encoded:
And don’t forget blogging as a good form of improvement ðŸ™‚

I read about 100 blog posts a month on a variety of technical and non-technical topics, blog (less frequently recently), and try to always have a project I am working on.

Another great resource is the many conferences and user groups that now record their sessions and put them up for free. Oredev, Teched, PASS recordings (login req’d), Velocity Conference, Mobilism conference, … I haven’t even gotten to any user groups yet and that’s probably weeks worth of content.

item.title: By: Koen Verbeeck
item.dc:creator: Koen Verbeeck
item.description: I will be investigating the BI integration of SQL Server with Office 2013.<br /> I might also follow an introductory course on Hadoop/Big Data.
item.content:encoded:
I will be investigating the BI integration of SQL Server with Office 2013.
I might also follow an introductory course on Hadoop/Big Data.

item.title: By: sqlsister
item.dc:creator: sqlsister
item.description: I just signed up for some free courses at Coursera on big data that I learned about at the PASS conference. At my age (almost 60, when did that happen?), you need something that is hot and where there is a shortage of people with the right knowledge to stay marketable.
item.content:encoded: I just signed up for some free courses at Coursera on big data that I learned about at the PASS conference. At my age (almost 60, when did that happen?), you need something that is hot and where there is a shortage of people with the right knowledge to stay marketable.
